p: Pain in the ligaments, headache, fatigue, and severe tiredness, digestive symptoms (diarrhea, vomiting, gastrointestinal bleeding, nausea or abdominal pain), red eyes, conjunctivitis, and lymphadenopathy have also been described, only during the acute phase of infection ( Economopoulou et al., 2009); therefore, the impact on the quality of life of people affected by the infection begins with the first symptoms and extends to the remission of polyarthralgia at the end of the chronic phase.
